docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: For more than 20 years in this city of scholars and elms, schoolchildren and their parents have been studying a basic axiom: students in troubled schools learn better when families and educators work together.

headline.main: The Home's Link To School Success;   A New Road to Learning: Teaching the Whole Child

docs.snippet: LEAD: For more than 20 years in this city of scholars and elms, schoolchildren and their parents have been studying a basic axiom: students in troubled schools learn better when families and educators work together.

byline.original: By MICHEL MARRIOTT, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE array of infections that strike people with AIDS is undergoing a profound shift that will affect patients, their doctors and the ability of the health care system to cope with the rising number of AIDS cases.

headline.main: Advances In Treatment Change Face Of AIDS

docs.snippet: LEAD: THE array of infections that strike people with AIDS is undergoing a profound shift that will affect patients, their doctors and the ability of the health care system to cope with the rising number of AIDS cases.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Amgen Inc. is coming under pressure from Government officials who contend that Medicare is paying too high a price for the company's anti-anemia drug, erythropoetin, or EPO.

headline.main: U.S. Scrutiny On Price of Amgen Drug

docs.snippet: LEAD: Amgen Inc. is coming under pressure from Government officials who contend that Medicare is paying too high a price for the company's anti-anemia drug, erythropoetin, or EPO.

byline.original: By LAWRENCE M. FISHER, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The sun beats down on green fields of corn that have never seen chemical insecticides or weed killers. Over the ridge, docile Holsteins are producing more milk on less feed than has ever before been possible, and piglets are growing into lean adults at uncommon speed. The air is free of dust from eroding topsoil and a stream drains the gentle slopes, its waters as sweet and pure as a mountain spring.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: American agriculture has few symbols more popular than the Holstein cow. Her wholesome, black-and-white form decorates bedsheets, coffee mugs and countless other household items.

headline.main: All About/Dairy Farming;   Cows on a Technological Tightrope
